column4: im having problem with ubuntu 12.04 i got "input not supprted" on my screen. i tried the forums but i don't know how to enter the Safe Graphics Mode to configure the screen size that causes "Input not Supported" msg. please help!
any tips on how to restore my dsktop?
no not yet
how do i back up?
has your screen ever worked ? or did it never work ?
yes my desktop worked before i upgraded
ok, so it's the upgrade that broke it
what video card do you have ?
matrox
ok, so an ATI
the upgrade was from 11.10 to 12.04 ? or some other version
yes from 11.10 to 12.04
can you be specific about the card make/model
my graphics cardi is Matrox Graphics 32MB
ok,
do you know how to boot into recovery mode ?
how do i boot in recovery mode?
you should have a recovery option on your grub menu
yes. i did use all the recovery mode options at the grub menu but still the same
really, you still get that if you hit the recovery shell option
yes. all the options still the same
ok, so we know it's the framebuffer rather than X that's the issue in this situation
what to do if it's the framebuffer that causes the issue? any steps?
sorry, I was just dealing with something else, how are you progressing ?
